Contributing

Thank you for your interest in contributing to mitosis-plugins! This guide provides all the information you need to get started.

Code of Conduct

Section titled “Code of Conduct”

This project adheres to a code of conduct. By participating, you are expected to uphold this code. Please read our Code of Conduct before contributing.

Getting Started

Section titled “Getting Started”

Development Setup

Section titled “Development Setup”

  1. Fork the repository on GitHub

  2. Clone your fork locally:

  3. Install dependencies:

  4. Run tests to ensure everything is working:

Project Structure

Section titled “Project Structure”
  • Directorymitosis-plugins/
    • Directorysrc/ Plugin source code
      • Directorymagic-imports/ Magic Imports plugin
        • …
      • Directoryindex-generator/ Index Generator plugin
        • …
      • Directorystory-generator/ Story Generator plugin
        • …
      • Directoryrich-types/ Rich Types plugin
        • …
      • Directorytarget-files/ Target Files plugin
        • …
      • Directorycss-modules/ CSS Modules plugin
        • …
    • Directorytemplates/ Story templates
      • …
    • Directorytests/ Test files
      • …
    • Directoryexamples/ Example configurations
      • …
    • README.md Main documentation

How to Contribute

Section titled “How to Contribute”

Reporting Issues

Section titled “Reporting Issues”

Before creating an issue:

  1. Check if the issue already exists in the issue tracker
  2. Ensure you’re using the latest version
  3. Provide a minimal reproduction when possible

When creating an issue, please include:

  • Clear title and description
  • Steps to reproduce
  • Expected vs actual behavior
  • Environment details (Node.js version, OS, etc.)

Suggesting Features

Section titled “Suggesting Features”

Feature requests are welcome! Please:

  1. Check if the feature already exists or is planned
  2. Explain the use case and why it would be valuable
  3. Consider if it can be implemented as a separate plugin
  4. Be open to discussion and alternative solutions

Submitting Pull Requests

Section titled “Submitting Pull Requests”

  1. Create a branch:

  2. Make your changes:

    • Follow the existing code style
    • Write tests for new functionality
    • Update documentation as needed
    • Keep commits atomic and well-described

  3. Test your changes:

  4. Commit your changes:

    We use Conventional Commits:

    • feat: New feature
    • fix: Bug fix
    • docs: Documentation changes
    • test: Test additions or changes
    • refactor: Code refactoring
    • chore: Maintenance tasks

  5. Push and create a PR:

    Then create a pull request on GitHub with:

    • Clear description of changes
    • Reference to any related issues
    • Screenshots/examples if applicable

Code Style

Section titled “Code Style”
  • Use TypeScript for type safety
  • Follow existing formatting (we use Prettier)
  • Write self-documenting code with clear variable names
  • Add JSDoc comments for public APIs
  • Keep functions small and focused

Testing

Section titled “Testing”
  • Write unit tests for new functionality
  • Ensure all tests pass before submitting PR
  • Add integration tests for plugin interactions
  • Test with real Mitosis projects when possible

Documentation

Section titled “Documentation”
  • Update README.md if adding new features
  • Update plugin-specific documentation in src/
  • Add code examples for new configurations
  • Keep documentation clear and concise

Plugin Development

Section titled “Plugin Development”

Creating a New Plugin

Section titled “Creating a New Plugin”

  1. Create a new directory in src/:

  2. Create the plugin structure:

    • Directorysrc/my-plugin/
      • index.ts Main plugin export
      • plugin.ts Plugin implementation
      • README.md Plugin documentation
      • Directorytests/ Plugin tests
        • plugin.test.ts

  3. Export from main index:

  4. Follow existing plugin patterns for consistency

Plugin Best Practices

Section titled “Plugin Best Practices”
  • Use the appropriate Mitosis hook (code.pre, json.post, etc.)
  • Provide sensible defaults
  • Make configuration optional when possible
  • Add debug logging for troubleshooting
  • Handle errors gracefully
  • Document all configuration options

Release Process

Section titled “Release Process”

Releases are managed by maintainers:

  1. Version bumps follow semantic versioning
  2. Changelog is auto-generated from conventional commits
  3. GitHub releases are created with release notes
  4. Package is published to npm

Getting Help

Section titled “Getting Help”
  • Check existing documentation and examples
  • Look through existing issues and discussions
  • Ask questions in GitHub Discussions
  • Open an issue if you need clarification

Recognition

Section titled “Recognition”

Contributors are recognized in:

  • Release notes for significant contributions
  • README.md contributors section (for major contributions)
  • Repository insights/graphs

Thank you for contributing to mitosis-plugins!

If you’d like to support the project financially, check out our Sponsor page.

This contributing guide is inspired by Atom’s Contributing Guide.
